expression: cost an arm and a leg

selectionMeta.selectedPhrase: cost an arm and a leg

step1.sentence: The repairs on my old car cost an arm and a leg, so I decided to buy a new one instead.

step2.story: Nina loved that designer jacket in the window but checked the price tag and stepped back. It cost an arm and a leg, and she walked away promising herself she would save up for it.

step3.story: James and his partner had dreamed of visiting Japan for years. When they finally sat down to budget the trip, the flights alone cost an arm and a leg. They spent an entire Saturday crunching numbers, comparing dates, and looking for deals, eventually finding a departure window that cut the cost nearly in half. It was still expensive, but they booked it anyway, agreeing that some experiences were worth every penny.

meaning.realUsageKo: 무언가의 가격이 터무니없이 비쌀 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 20세기 초 미국 속어에서 시작된 표현으로, 팔다리처럼 대체 불가능한 것을 내줄 만큼 비싸다는 의미입니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 불만이나 놀라움을 담아 쓰는 표현으로, 가격에 압도당한 느낌을 강조합니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Healthcare in this country costs an arm and a leg.
